metadata.title: CVE-2015-1281 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
core/loader/ImageLoader.cpp in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before44.0.2403.89, does not properly determine the V8 context of a microtask,which allows remote attackers to bypass Content Security Policy (CSP)restrictions by providing an image from an unintended source.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-browser-l10n - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-chromedriver - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
